Edited October 15, 2013 by Spartwo

The rules keep changing. This was an unintentional infraction.

I don't actually see a way to kill these Salvations, so I concede the battle until I can come up with some better armament and get better at aiming at high speed.

They change as exploits such as that one are discovered.I'm keeping it about who has the better weapons/armor than who has enough fuel to deorbit a dreadnought.I don't point out little breakages but not game changing ones.

EDIT:Let me see...

They change as exploits such as that one are discovered.I'm keeping it about who has the better weapons/armor than who has enough fuel to deorbit a dreadnought.I don't point out little breakages but not game changing ones.

Let me see...

I totally see why you ban de-orbiting enemies.

I only tried to do that because all my high-speed shots are misses, so I thought I'd do a slow and calculated one instead.

Since that's not allowed, I'll cut my losses and re-work my ships.

Arrrrrrrrrrrrgh KSP!At least I know what causes it & how to fix it.

I could use some advice. There must be something basic about aiming or building missiles I don't know.

I also need to improve my armour. I've made some improvements, but the Khopesh disintegrated so easily.

I could use some advice. There must be something basic about aiming or building missiles I don't know.

Well main sections of ships contain docking ports set them as targets individually.

If you're terrible at aiming(Like me)Set the nav-ball size up.

Spin stabilisation:If it works for rovers it works for missiles.

Just remember the thread name.

I could use some advice. There must be something basic about aiming or building missiles I don't know.

I also need to improve my armour. I've made some improvements, but the Khopesh disintegrated so easily.

For armor u will want to talk with Zeke or Spartwo

As for weapons I can help with that

Also the best way with aiming is to practice practice practice

You can do this by setting up your own battles and playing against yourself.

Also one big thing you can do is download others ships and learn from them

My Salvation and Archangel are based on Macy Deans Vanguard and my Zion frigate is somewhat modeled after Zekes Drek destroyers. My Cherub fighters are a thinner version of Macey deans shade fighter. I just took that model, learned how it was made and made it thinner so it could fit in a carrier

And don't hesitate to ask people for downloads

Worst they can say is no

Well main sections of ships contain docking ports set them as targets individually.

If you're terrible at aiming(Like me)Set the nav-ball size up.

You can do that?

How?

Which part?

Nav-ball can be set to

tiny-small-smallish-medium-biggish-big

from the first tab of the settings

To select individual ports

Right click when they are highlighted and press set as target.

The nav ball
